fields.description: A simple RSS feed including a single issue would be handy.  As standalone, as well as a getIssue() method in the evolution integration API.
fields.summary: Retreive RSS feed with specific issue

fields.description:
Mark Derricutt has created an intellij plugin.  We should provide him with more access to JIRA via a remote API.

Here is his list of suggested things to implement:

1. Access to jira installation metadata.
1.1 List of available projects to the user, in rss, with items for
project name, description, lead developer, project id, etc. etc.
1.2 List of available resolutions, issue types, issue status', and other
lookup information, also in rss.
1.3 Admin metadata, admin email details/names/urls in rss.
1.4 User access to Jelly ( limited tags, access restricted ).  For
editing/updating/commenting issues, I'm currently looking at just doing
HTTP push/form submission, but the URL wrangling is a kinda messy
approach, esp. when theres Jelly sitting there.  I've used it before in
a simple Jira Log4j appender, but it requires the user to have admin
access.
fields.summary: Create XML-RPC or SOAP interface for Intellij plugin

fields.description: Need the ability to bulk link tasks. Im creating lots of issue types that serve as categories, can't get by without this feature.
fields.summary: Bulk linking of tasks

fields.description:
It appears that the attachment process isn't completed before a comment is added, so that if an optional comment is added and something causes an error during this process the file is not attached/loaded onto the server.  However the link does appear saying the file is there.

This was found while working on some customizations of ours, and what we did to cause the problem was by having the comments attempt to use the same PK in the jiraaction table as a comment already in the table.  Tomcat then throws an PK violation SQL server error.  While this occured also during other processes such as re-assigning issues, etc.  When the error occured during re-assigning an issue the issue was still re-assigned only the comment wasn't added.  During attaching a file, the file name was listed as an attachment in manage attachments however the file was never uploaded to the server.  

While this was directly caused by our own doings, it doesn't seem to make sense that the file appeared attached, yet the process was not completed when the comment was being added.  Just something you might want to look into.
fields.summary: Attachments don't fully attach if error on comment occurs
Unable to change issue link type

fields.description:
The provided RSS feeds don't expost the issue id field as they do for such things as type/priority/status.

For normal daily RSS use this doesn't matter, but when making a smart aggregator ( such as my IDEA Plugin ) which wants to do HTTP posts back into Jira to update records, we need this id.

The RSS currently emits:

  <key>INTPLUG-34</key>

and a suggested change would be to emit:

  <key id="nnnn">INTPLUG-34</key>
fields.summary: RSS Feeds don't include issue id's

fields.description: You should do Text To Speech. Everyon's doing it, even though it sounds like bad 70s sci-fi.
fields.summary: Text to Speech

fields.description:
Jira Enterprise Edition, Version: 2.5.3-#59

When you look at the full content-print-preview the first page is empty. The first issue is printed on the second page - but starting in the middle of the page and so on.
fields.summary: Print of full content incorrect

fields.description:
When adding a work item (with time used), it is possible to do multiple clicks on the record (submit) button.
Each click will result in a new work record (and increase the total amount of time spend).
Sometimes connections are slow, so this will be a bug, frequently trapped into.

- sorry for my englich - my german is much better ;-)) 

Best regards,

Holger
fields.summary: Multiple clicks (form actions) not suppressed

fields.description: This could potentially be a security hole - as you can see all the groups in the system (even ones that you are not a member of).
fields.summary: View user shows user's groups

fields.description:
The symptoms of this are an exception like this:

2004-02-05 14:39:25,765 ERROR [jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] Problem with path d:\Jira\Index/issues: Lock obtain timed out
java.io.IOException: Lock obtain timed out
	at org.apache.lucene.store.Lock.obtain(Lock.java:97)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.<init>(IndexWriter.java:173)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.<init>(IndexWriter.java:151)


Followed by many other exceptions like this:

2004-02-05 14:39:38,437 ERROR [jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager] Giving up reindex - waited 10 seconds
com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.IndexException
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.getIndexLock(DefaultIndexManager.java:409)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssues(DefaultIndexManager.java:94)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexIssues(DefaultIndexManager.java:83)
	at com.atlassian.jira.action.component.ComponentDelete.doExecute(ComponentDelete.java:45)
fields.summary: Under heavy load, indexing may stop

fields.description: The Bugzilla importer suggests project keys by taking the first few characters of the Bugzilla project name.  If this name contains (for example) a dash, the generated JIRA project key will be invalid, resulting in much unhappiness.
fields.summary: Bugzilla importer allows invalid project keys

fields.description: When an issue type is deleted, all global fields are made specific to the type of issue chosen as a replacement.  Only custom fields specific to the to-be-deleted type should be changed.
fields.summary: Deleting an issue type makes all global fields type-specific

fields.description: Currently the menu is too long.  We should collapse it.
fields.summary: Improve navigation of admin menu items

fields.description:
We'd like to be able to generate some project statistics/trend graphs 
from JIRA to assist project management. The type of report we are after would graph the number of issues (that meet the report criteria) against time.

e.g. A fault density report that would show the number of 
issues created on a given day

No. of Faults 
     |
     |
     |       *     *
     |                  *
     |      
     |  *
     |                       *
     |
      ---------------------------
        1/5  2/5  3/5  4/5  5/5	Day


Other examples:
- total open issues (ie issues in open state) each week 
- number of issues that are resolved each day
- number of issues that are close each day
etc

Basically we are trying to report trends so that the PMs can easily see how a project is doing.

JIRA doesn't have to be able to graph the data (tho that would be nice).  

It would be sufficient to be able to export it to excel easily.  It would be even better to be able to export it to a supplied excel template (so we could create a report/graph template in excel, upload the template & JIRA fills it out with the data to produce the report).
fields.summary: Add abililty to report/graph project trends

fields.description: When an "In Progress" issue is reassigned, the issue will still appear on the original user's "Open Issues: In Progress" portlet, and will still appear in searches for 'In Progress' issues.  A manual reindex is required to fix this.
fields.summary: Reassigning an In Progress issue does not update search indexes and portlets

fields.description:
If you set a Component Assignee.
Edit and Issue and change it to be in above Component.
Edit Issue again and select Assign --Automatic--
Get back Message saying User -1 is not found.
fields.summary: Auto Assign when editing Issue with Default assignee set to Component Lead

fields.description: Ensure that the documentation is up to date and relfects all changes made for version 2.6. Add/modify/delete documentation sections as needed to reflect these changes.
fields.summary: Ensure documentation reflects changes made for 2.6

fields.description: Ensure all text keys through JIRA are internationalizied.
fields.summary: Ensure all text keys are fully i18n-ized

fields.description:
During writing the IntelliJ Plugin I'm hitting the problem of Jira returning formatted dates in the RSS feed rather than a standard/consistent date format.

This means I'm going to have to add a setting to the plugin for the date format unless Jira spits out consistent date formats.

I'm not sure if the RSS spec specifies a particular date format, but if so, that should be used.
fields.summary: RSS feeds should use consistent date format, regardless of locale/timezone settings

fields.description:
After an issue is created, we are unable to edit the description field.   Adding text to the description field and then clicking save silently drops the new data. 

This happens irrespective of size of the descripton field.

This does not happen with a stock download of Jira, so I assume it has to do with how custom fields and issuetypes are setup in our instance.  I can provide an XML dump of the data if necessary.
fields.summary: Updating description field silently loses data

fields.description:
The jira-workflow.xml contains entries like the following:
<validator type="class">
  <arg name="class.name">com.atlassian.jira.workflow.validator.NotNullPermissionValidator</arg>
  <arg name="permission">Assign</arg>
  <arg name="varskey">assignee</arg>
</validator>

In the code for NotNullPermissionValidator:
String varKey = (String) args.get("vars.key");


There are both vars.key and varskey in jira-workflow.xml.  Are the entries broken?
fields.summary: jira-workflow.xml typo

fields.description:
JIRA has a default portlet called "Open Issues: Assigned To Me".  Actually, it only displays Open or Reopened issues assigned to me; not my "In Progress" issues.

It can be argued that because a separate "Open Issues: In Progress" portlet exists (right below, in the default dashboard), issues should not be duplicated in both portlets.  In that case, we should clarify this somehow in the portlet.
fields.summary: Assigned to Me portlet does not display In Progress issues

fields.description: The code is supplied by BNP
fields.summary: Create a bulk e-mailer that allows to send an e-mail to members of selected groups

fields.description:
class com.atlassian.jira.web.bean.UserBrowserFilter throws a NullPointerException if any user has a null email.  see around line 72 in that class.

I expect that under "normal" circumstances, a user's email can never be null.  But there is nothing in the underlying OSUser contract that requires this, and its best to be cautious.
fields.summary: NPE when email is nulll

fields.description:
When creating an issue the assignee select box sorts with username.  But the display name is showed in the dropdown, creating the problem of non-sorted select box.  This is a pain with over 600 hundred possible assigness.  Is there any configuration that can be done to fix this.

Thx.
fields.summary: Assignee Dropdown sorts by username, can this be changed?

fields.description:
Since editing XML workflow files is very closed to programming, it's necessary that you provide a web editor so that administrators can modify it easily. 
Today, it's too difficult to edit the XML workflow file and to test it.
The editor should offer to the user a proper interface to guide him across the creation of workflow steps and workflow actions, without the need to know JIRA internal classes names or other internal stuffs.
The editor should always generate valid XML files.
The user should also be authorised to manually modify the XML file and the editor should be able to read and analyse manual changes.

There's no need to have a complex graphical view of the workflow, but only wizards that guide the user across the creation of steps and actions.
fields.summary: A workflow web editor

fields.description: For example if a notification mail is in the queue and the user to whcih the mail is meant to go is deleted from JIRA, an exception is thrown, but since the IssueMailQueueItem is never incremented the message never goes to the error queue.
fields.summary: IssueMailQueueItem error count is never incremented

fields.description:
When the Mantis importer encounters an "Assigned" bug, it creates a JIRA issue with state "In Progress".  However it fails to set the OSWorkflow 'owner'.  This means that the <restrict-to> precondition on the "Stop Progress" action isn't met, so the link doesn't display.

The workaround is to manually set the OWNER field of the issue's record in the OS_CURRENTSTEP table.
fields.summary: Mantis importer: Assigned issues (In Progress) do not have "Stop Progress" link

fields.description: The Bugzilla importer fails with a NullPointerException when importing data that was imported from an older Bugzilla install that has nulls or 0's in the submitter_id field of the attachments table.
fields.summary: Bugzilla importer fails when importing data upgraded from old (2.1.11) Bugzilla install

fields.description: Add ability to configure the "from" email address per project. If no email address is specified for the project - the default "from" address as set in the mail server admin page is used.
fields.summary: Add ability to configure "from" email address per project.

fields.description:
1. Replace the "Import from Bugzilla" and "Import from Mantis" links with one link - "External System Import" and create a page where users can choose bugzilla or mantis.

2. Move the "Refresh Statistics" link from the admin left hand menu to the Re-Indexing page.
fields.summary: Clean admin interface

fields.description: It would be nice if, in the Browse Project page, one could "drill down" to display stats and filters specific to a version.  Once a version's features are specced, developers are generally only interested in stats within that version.
fields.summary: Per-version Browse Project page

fields.description:
We have a project in which multiple clients can enter issues, however using Issue Security Levels they cannot see each other's issues.  This is great, and what we want.

However, we also wanted to set up a notification scheme in which users of ONE of the groups would get notifications when any of their issues were touched.  Unfortunately what appears to happen is that they will get emails for issues that are in Issue Security levels they are not allowed to see!  In other words, once we add the group to be notified, that group gets notifications even for issues they cannot see.

Having Jira check Issue security before notifying to be sure the user is allowed to see the issue would be a great enhancement.
fields.summary: Notifications should respect Issue Security Levels

fields.description:
When I try to access the following url:

http://<JIRA_server/port>/jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&mode=hide&pid=10261&resolutionIds=-1&sorter/field=lastupdated&sorter/order=DESC

I get the following error:

System Error

A system error has occurred.

If this problem persists - please notify your JIRA administrator of this problem.

If you are an administrator, please try submitting this problem via the Support Request Page.

If you experience problems getting to this support page, please send an email to jira-support@atlassian.com with the following information:

   1. a description of your problem
   2. cut & paste the error and system information found below
   3. attach the application server log file 

Cause:
You do not have the permissions to browse this project

com.atlassian.jira.exception.PermissionException: You do not have the permissions to browse this project


This happens because I'm not logged in yet. When I first log in and then try again it works.

It would be better to show the login page instead of a user unfriendly stacktrace.


regards,
Hilbert Schraal
Contrado
Netherlands
fields.summary: When trying to access a project via direct url when not logged in you get a stacktrace
Report Count of Open Issues by Type in Browse Project
Enable the build process of the webapp compile custom source files

fields.description:
1. Need to write an upgrade task to populate the new STATE column.
2. Need to ensure all the Exceptions that are thrown in the new version are dealt with properly.
3. Some of the methods of the Workflow class no longer throw exceptions but return blank values. Need to ensure they are properly tested.
fields.summary: Upgrade to OS Workflow 2.6

fields.description:
A new portlet in the "Projects" portlet style would be great where not only the project name and (maybe) the status for EVERY PROJECT is listed, but also a (limited ?) number of open bugs for this project (maybe additionally with a filter).

So you don't have to define a "Display Filter" portlet for every project you're working at (or for every new user).
fields.summary: New Portlet: List all projects + bugs

fields.description:
It would be great if the JIRA admin could define an unlimited number of predefined centrals (the site which you get when you click HOME). 

Users would then be able to either choose from the already predefined views, or simply create their own. 

The admin should be given the possibility to set default views for different user groups.
fields.summary: Unlimited number of predefined centrals (HOME)

fields.description:
! Versions are no longer visible in Browse Project View
! No Fix Version List in Create Issue View

We do not known, which user action triggered the failure.
Now the failure is persistent. Even if you backup the data and restore it in a fresh JIRA installation - s. attached backup: noversion.zip.
fields.summary: Versions no longer visible in Browse Project View

fields.description: Under User Preferences, we can only state the email format as either Text or HTML.  We need to be able to send report(s) in Excel format as well.
fields.summary: Add Excel as a Mail Format Type
Add the ability to send subscribed reports to a server.

fields.description: A "my roadmap" feature would be great. The roadmap is very good when you are alone on a project, but as soon as you are a few people it suddenly gets cluttered up. A "my roadmap" which only shows issues that are assigned to me. Also a "unassigned roadmap" would be useful to complement this.
fields.summary: my roadmap

fields.description:
We would like to use JIRA in english and in french. Unfortunately, JIRA is not available in french.
We have made a traduction here of 75 % of the properties files. Do you plan to translate JIRA into french ?
if not, maybe we can send you our translations files so that you can save some time for the translation ?
fields.summary: French language support

fields.description:
I am unable to post a comment if it gets much larger than the text form. Some simple testing resulted in a comment 15 lines and 240 bytes long being accepted, but a comment 28 lines and 1800 bytes failing. 

By failing, the browser stops showing it's 'waiting' animation, but does not give any timeout message. it just leaves the "add comment" page open.
fields.summary: Can't post a comment over a given size

fields.description:
The SMTP server config has:
Edit
Del
Send a Test Email

But the POP/IMAP Servers only have:
Edit
Del


They must feel so left out.  How bout a Make Test Connection?  Not for me, for the poor servers.


(also, minor aesthetic point: "POP /IMAP Mail Servers".  There should be as many spaces after the slash as before.)
fields.summary: Include "Test" button for POP/IMAP servers like SMTP has

fields.description:
I am having two problems that may be related. 

I was not getting a button to show up on the administration panel that would allow me to "Add Custom Type". Despite having entered custom fields before, it simply is not there anymore. I obviously have Jira Administrator priveleges since I was on the admin screen. I bypassed this inconvienence by directly entering the URL (/secure/admin/CreateCustomField.jspa). This took me to the proper pages where I entered a Free Text field. I did not give it a default value. I added it to my project.

Now when I edit my project, the custom field appears and it contains this content:

[GenericEntity:CustomField][default,No Status][name,Narrative Status][issuetype,null][fieldtype,3][description,This field will be used on some executive management reports and should summarize the current status of the issue.][project,10140][id,10010]

I have since gone in and supplied a default value, and it still displays the garbage content. Any attempts to change the garbage content results in no change to the data. There are no error messages in the log.
fields.summary: Error while adding free text custom field

fields.description:
We have a user that has been removed from the system, but who still has an outstanding subscription in the email queue that I believe is causing our mail queue to clog and stop sending.  This may be resolved by issue JIRA-2487, but I need a workaround.

In the mail queue, there is always an item that says "Subscription: Everything... Jan 15, 2003" with no errors.

The stack trace is:

[10:53:43,622,Default] com.opensymphony.module.user.EntityNotFoundException: No user ~@!#@!# found
	at com.opensymphony.module.user.UserManager.getEntity(UserManager.java:306)
	at com.opensymphony.module.user.UserManager.getUser(UserManager.java:120)
	at com.atlassian.jira.mail.SubscriptionMailQueueItem.send(SubscriptionMailQueueItem.java:70)
	at com.atlassian.jira.mail.MailQueueImpl.sendBuffer(MailQueueImpl.java:52)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.MailQueueAdmin.doExecute(MailQueueAdmin.java:24)

Where is the mail queue stored?  Is it in a table in the db?  I have perused the tables and can't seem to find anyplace I can remove this lingering subscription.  My hope is that removing this entry from the queue will allow the queue to function properly.

Flushing the mail queue will flush any clogged notifications, but this one entry still remains.
fields.summary: Email queue stops sending
Work  logging usability improvement
Use in work logging percents of work completeв

fields.description:
From mailing list:

As mentioned in the initial report we're using Sybase ASE version 12.5 with the delivered JDBC driver jConnect 5.5.

I don't know the exact cause of this problem, I only know that Sybase is a factor of it.  I have searched the web but not found any conclusive answers, just clues.  It seems that by either appending "JCONNECT_VERSION=6" to the JDBC URL or specifying some additional properties (as suggested on http://tinyurl.com/3gp8g) it is possible to get it to work; i.e. then it is possible to edit all fields of an issue.  But I still get all these error messages about the DataSource which isn't found at startup of Tomcat.

So for now I can work again.  But I suspect that anybody using JIRA on Tomcat with Sybase ASE 12.5 will run into the same problems; although I have no idea if this is limited to Tomcat.  So it's still something that should be investigated.  Maybe this post provides some clues: http://tinyurl.com/26uxu.




Would be good to add a note to the Sybase doco
  http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/standalone-dbconfig.html#sybase
So other users can try this.
fields.summary: Add note to Sybase database config

fields.description: Can't filter by Issue Type or Component in the Issue Navigator. Would be a lot more useful to provide these and other combinations of filtering criteria.
fields.summary: Filter by Type and/or Component in Issue Navigator

fields.description:
I created a few custom fields, eg Customer, and Distributor, but can't seem to filter issues by any of these custom fields. Very much would like to do so, as I need to be able to track requests by specific customers, who will not be connected or logging requests directly. 

The Customer field is a 'Select from List' type of field, and is common to all issue types.
fields.summary: Ability to Filter by Custom Field eg Customer
Implement distribution of language property files as jars

fields.description: It would be lovely if we could do this.  Not that we ever need to push an issue to a later release or anything.  Not us.  It's for everyone else.
fields.summary: Ability to bulk edit "Fix Version"

fields.description: When using the online help to access the definition of priority by clicking on the yellow question mark next to the priority field anywhere, the definitions are not dynamic for our install of JIRA, instead they are the JIRA default definitions.  We would like to be able to see our custom definitions of priority next to the priority field.
fields.summary: Description of Priority when using online help not dynamic

fields.description: It is not possible to modify the remaining work estimate using the Log Work dialog without entering something in the Time Spent field at the same time. One could do this using the edit issue dialog, but users having work logging permission do not have necessarily edit issue permission. In addition, edit issue is unavailable for closed issues.
fields.summary: Impossible to adjust remaining work estimate

fields.description:
Its very useful to know what users in your system are essentially "dead".

Being able to see the last login date for a given user (in the user details) will give you a hint as to whether this user actually uses jira anymore. This helps with the data cleaning...
fields.summary: User statistics: Record and display last login date for user on UserManagement details

fields.description:
Currently, users enter their emails with a mix of upper and lowercase.

However, the UserBrowser email filter is case sensitive.

Can we 

1) store all emails as lowercase (convert on upgrade!)
2) make the search case insensitive

-Nick
fields.summary: Case insensitive email filter in UserBrowser

fields.description:
Issues now do not display at all on Resin 2.1.x, when used with German/Danish/other non-English character sets (see screenshot).

Not really much we can do about this (Resin's filters are known to be broken), except wait for 3.x to stabilize.
fields.summary: JIRA i18n breaks on Resin

fields.description:
Add ability to create/edit a change log to a project in roadmap view.

* Default change log will include the issue id and the description.
* User change log is shown with default change log when editing.
* Include road map component to provide links to the issues when editing the change log.
fields.summary: Add change log creator/editor to project roadmap view
Request info from a user

fields.description: Get the handler that Owen is using for Bacio, and put it back into JIRA so that our clients can also use it.
fields.summary: Add pophandler that creates a new user if they don't exist
mail integration should bounce to unregistered emails

fields.description:
The issue navigator does not sort properly when sorting on the resolution column.

This can be demonstrated on the Atlassian Jira with any filter that return a mix of issue resolutions

http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?sorter/field=resolution&mode=hide&sorter/order=ASC
fields.summary: Cannot sort by resolution

fields.description:
Create user does accept names with umlaut äöü but entered user editing is not possible, "invalid characters".

Why did no warning pop up to avoid entering äöü characters.
fields.summary: special character not supported e.g. german umlaut äöü

fields.description:
Hi,

We make regular use of the roadmap and would like the ability to download it to Excel.  It will copy & paste reasonably well, but would be nice to have the feature built in.  I tried to recreate the roadmap with filter, but one cannot order by the 'Fix For' column.

Cheers,

  Mike
fields.summary: Provide Excel export of Roadmap

fields.description:
In this context a user authenticated to LDAP should not see a "Set Password" link on the user data screen.  

On the "Forgot Password" screen that comes up when a user is found in the LDAP directory but authentication fails, there should not be a "Send it to me" button.  This just sends a useless password to the user.  Rather, it should tell the user to contact their directory administrator.
fields.summary: Useless passwords and LDAP authentication

fields.description:
I just spent 1/2 hour composing the description of a new issue.  I pressed the question mark after the Priority pull down to see what items in that list mean.  When I hit the browser back button I my work was gone. !@#$%^&*()_

Why doesn't it pop up a window?
fields.summary: Using Priority help on the Create Issue Step 2 of 2 screen

fields.description:
I would like the ability to have a custom field that i can choose what step of the workflow it appears in. Ie fields that display in 'edit issue', but also are displayed when hitting 'resolve' or 'close' issue - to remind users to enter this data.

Similar (but prob seperate issue) is ability to enter work done at the resolve screen - otherwise have to resolve the issue, then remember to enter work done. having this afailable on the resolve and close screens (customisable whether it displays of course) would help to remind users to enter this info.
fields.summary: custom fields in resolve and close workflow steps

fields.description: Occasionally users will accidently log the wrong amount of work, or log it twice (refresh page). Admins need ability to delete work logs.
fields.summary: Ability for admins to delete work log records

fields.description:
Chaps,

In the CSV import JSP file, you refer to "issueType" in line 169, whereas the application is expecting "issuetype" with a small 't'.

This prevents the file from working.

Cheers,

  Mike
fields.summary: Typo in CSV import JSP

fields.description:
It's nice that people want to share, but our users complain that filters show up on their dashboard that they don't want. 

My suggestion:

On the manage filters page, for each incoming shared filter, have a "Hide on dashboard" option.

With this, shared filters will:
1. by default show up on the dashboard 
2. Always be available on the "manage filters" page
3. be able to be removed from ( or shown on ) the dashboard
fields.summary: Ability to hide a shared filter

fields.description:
Bulk editing is a powerful feature, but I see it used mostly for administrative purposes, as it's usually only administrators (lead developers) who would do operations this large.

Ideally, we'd like to hide the operation from developers and other non-administrator users.

Having "Bulk Edit Issues" as a permission we can assing just to jira-administrators would be ideal.

That way, we can add more power to Bulk Edit (for example JRA-3019) without worrying about the dangers of using it improperly.
fields.summary: "Bulk Edit Issues" should be a permission

fields.description:
We'd like to be able to bulk edit the "affect versions" and "issue type" of many of our issues.

This is because our data was migrated from Mantis, where version and issue type information was quite limited.

Bulk editing features are very handy for doing the final touches to a migration, so the more powerful, the better.
fields.summary: Ability to bulk edit "affects versions" and "issue type" fields

fields.description:
At the moment the global settings can be set to allow or prevent unassigned issues. However when we allow unassigned issues, "Unassigned" is set as the assignee by default, which results in a large number of issues that nobody is focusing on. It would be nice to have the three following global settings for unassigned issues:

Unassigned issues:
a) Allow - with "unassigned" set as the default assignee
b) Allow - but with a nominated assignee set by default	
c) Don't allow - all issues will be assigned to a nominated default assignee

This way option b) allows unassigned issues, but only if that is what the user explicitly chooses.

The default assignee would probably be the project lead, although it may or may not be beneficial to be able to set this default assignee independently of being the project lead. I suppose that hinges on whether there is there any significance to "Project Lead" status other that being a default assignee.
fields.summary: Extension to global settings for unassigned issues

fields.description:
"I have made them all simple again, but you may want to add an enhancement to support all SMTP/RFC compliant address formats including the comments.  I am thinking in particular of users who may have addresses LDAP stuff like C=X/OU=y/U=z or perhaps arm/camsys@camsys.com or some such.  I have but passing familiarity with all the bewildering variations available..."

The email addresses that were failing were of the form:

 "abc def" <abc_def@yourdomain.com>

Perhaps we should send emails using their full name as this part of the email address?  That would be nice.
fields.summary: Full RFC compliant email addresses

fields.description: You are able to edit an existing priority type to be named that of another priority type, causing duplicate priority types to exist. The system should prevent this?
fields.summary: Duplicate priority names allowed

fields.description: You are able to edit an existing issue type to be named that of another issue type, causing duplicate issue types to exist.  The system should prevent this?
fields.summary: Duplicate Issue type names allowed

fields.description: Able to edit a status name to be duplicate of an existing status.  Should prevent this.
fields.summary: Duplicate status names allowed

fields.description:
My installation of Jira is regularly requiring restarts. It seems to be due to a memory consumption problem - when started it uses around 60M, but this grows over time (up to 100M within 30 minutes), and once it reaches 160M, the UI ceases to be responsive, and a number of identical errors are logged to "catalina.out". There are also stack traces being logged to the altlassion-jira log - see attached.

I will turn on "debug" logging in log4j and post any relevant extracts when it next fails.
fields.summary: Memory footprint of Jira increases, then it stops responding

fields.description:
This is evidenced by:

java.lang.NullPointerException
        at
com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.ConsistencyCheckImpl.initialise(ConsistencyCheckImpl.java:95)
        at
com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.ConsistencyLauncher.contextInitialized(ConsistencyLauncher.java:18)
        at
org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.listenerStart(StandardContext.java:3270)

The offending lines are:

EntityConfigUtil.DatasourceInfo datasourceInfo = EntityConfigUtil.getDatasourceInfo(CK_OFBIZ_DS_NAME);
if (DATABASE_TO_WATCH.equals(datasourceInfo.fieldTypeName)) //nullpointer
{

...
}

So it looks like JBoss is returning null for getDatasourceInfo.
fields.summary: JIRA does not run on JBoss 3.2.2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3011].
  {panel}

Hi

We'd like to use JIRA's time tracking features, but we find that they are quite dettached from the general workflow, so it's hard to force users to use them properly.

If users (developers) are not force to use it properly (log work, put estimates) then mistakes are easy to make, and the whole results are wrong (managers unhappy). Trying to force users to use the system properly through handbooks and other rules not enforced by the system becomes a burden to engineers (engineers unhappy).

Integrating a couple of restrictions and rules in the system, nothing very complex would make things much better.

For example, I've found a couple of already logged requests (JRA-1993, JRA-1744, JRA-868...) that seem quite reasonable to me, and would make things easier for users

- Force people to log work when resolving issues - at least present them with the dialog
- When resolving an issue, reset the "time left" field to 0

I also logged :

- JRA-3009 : Track time on tasks&subtasks
- JRA-3010 : Restriction on who/when work can be logged

Solving all these issues would make time tracking features in JIRA much more attractive, since they would be less of a burden for the developer (less room for mistakes), and much more reliable for managers.

My $.02
fields.summary: More strict rules for time tracking

fields.description:
At the moment in JIRA work can be logged by any user (with permission), no matter who the assignee is or what is the state of the issue.

I would expect that in most cases, only issues in progress can have work logged on them, and only the assignee can log that work. This would reduce the room for error when tracking time / logging work.

These restrictions could be optionally (for those people that may want to log the work involved on closing an issue, for example) enabled/disabled by the administrator.
fields.summary: Restriction on issue status / assignee when loggin work

fields.description:
A problem we currently have to workaround is the fact that we sometimes log high-level features that we then split into many smaller tasks, which we then link using a "subtask" link. I'm certain many companies do something similar.

The problem is that since for JIRA links are meaning-less, effort estimated on the high-level task won't be kept up-to-date with the effort involved in subtasks, etc.

In order to workaround this problem we have to specify quite a complex procedure for our developers.

If instead JIRA detected (or defined) this "subtask" links between issues, it would know it needs to add/substrack effort accordingly, etc.. and it would save developers & managers the effort.
fields.summary: Calculate issue estimates using subtask estimates

fields.description:
It would be nice, just for vanity purposes, to display the statistics  for our install on the "System Info" page
/admin/jira/ViewSystemInfo.jspa

ie
We have 356 Users in 189 Groups.
There are 76 Projects with 15,202 Issues containing 61,100 Comments and 4,995 Attachments.    

show in table as:
Users       356
Groups      189
Projects    76
Issues      15,202
Comments    61,100 
Attachments 4,995

there could be other stats to display(number of links) but these are the ones I found most interesting
fields.summary: Display more statistics on the "System Info" page

fields.description: Currently, if you add the "Fix For Version" as an Issue Navigator column, that column is not sortable. It would be nice to sort on that column, though some decisions might need to be made for cases where an issue had multiple "Fix For Versions"--perhaps the sort algorithm could pick the oldest version specified in this case?
fields.summary: Make "Fix For Version" in Issue Navigator a sortable column

fields.description:
We have a jira user (say "theuser") and a jira group (say "thegroup"). theuser used to be a member of thegroup, but now they are unrelated, i.e. theuser is *not* a member of thegroup anymore.

When I filter for "assignee in group: thegroup", the result includes an issue that is assigned to theuser, which is clearly wrong.
fields.summary: User group membership change does not update search index

fields.description:
This is almost similar to bug JRA-2787 (which was closed with no comment !). I REALLY need to be able to change the Reporter of a bug (in the administrator section for example) as you often need to know who can give you more information on the request (usually the reporter).

For example, this morning I had a bug entered by mistake by an 'anonymous' user. This was a configuration mistake (anonymous are not allowed anymore to create issues), but right now I have no way to reaffect it to the real reporter...
fields.summary: Changing Reporter of a bug

fields.description:
Professional Edition, Version: 2.5.3-#59

I did a query for issues reported by a specific user but I entered the full name of the user instead of their username. The form re-rendered with an error message and error hilighting around the field. The browser would not let the cursor enter the field either by clicking or tabbing.

This field normally allows entry.
fields.summary: Can enter username in 'Reported By' after non-existant user was tried

fields.description:
We want to setup multiple projects that will handle support issues (via email) for various projects. As an example I currently have a Fitting Software Support project that the field people use to raise and comment on issues that crop up in the field. 

If an issue occurs in the field they compose and email to xxx@domain.com and I have a service that monitors that email account and either creates a new issue in a project or adds a comment to an existing issue. It actually works quite well for if we add a comment to an issue, asking for more information say, JIRA automatically notifies the reporter and all they need to do is respond to that email. We're doing this because many of our field people are on the road all the time and mainly have access to email only. 

Now I've had several requests for the same setup for other projects. The problem is that the notification email sent by Jira is not configurable. I can setup a service that will monitor yyy@domain.com but all the notifications will come from fittingsoftwaresupport@cochlear.com and therefore responding to that email would create a new issue in the Fitting Software Support project rather than create a comment in the Implant Support Project. (from cochlear.com)
fields.summary: Allow per-project 'from' address for notifications

fields.description:
Memory is getting used up quite quickly and when the limit gets close to being reached JIRA bogs down like a fly in Molasses.

[copied and pasted from admin page]

Java VM Memory Statistics
  Total Memory 	63 MB
  Free Memory 	3 MB
  Used Memory 	60 MB
  Memory Graph 	
	
	  5 % Free
fields.summary: Java VM Memory

fields.description:
Forgive me if this a duplicate, I search existing issues but nothing came up that addressed finding only the number portion of a key.

Please add a field that allows you to simply enter only the number of a issue key to the "Issue Attributes" section of the default search filter. This would also be a very handy feature to have available at all times (i.e., like the quick search or a portlet).

[behavior]
If the "All Projects" is selected then it will return every issue with that number in its key otherwise it will only return the issues having that number in its key for the selected project.
fields.summary: Add key NUMBER (only number) searching to default search filter.

fields.description:
When someone closes an issue, the email update says:
The following issue has been closed. 

Frequently neither the asignee, nor the reporter is the one that closed it. (In our case, it is frequently someone in QA.) To find out who closed it you have to click thru to the website, login, then click on the "Change History" and then scroll to the bottom to find out who closed it.  Frustrating.

This problem doesn't happen on other issue changes because the (HTML format, at least,) email says who made what change.
fields.summary: HTML emails should include who closed an issue

fields.description:
It is currently impossible to delete a user if this user reported or is currently assigned to any issue. Issues can be reassigned by hand (tedious) but it's impossible to change the reporter of issues (see JRA-927)

It would be much easier if the administrator was given an option to substitute the deleted user for another, selectable user.

Otherwise it is really hard to maintain the list of users to a manageable size.

(ideally, two substitutes -one for assigned issues, one for reported issues- can be specified)
fields.summary: Ability to delete users even if they are assignees / reporters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-2997].
  {panel}


As stated in JRA-1678, custom fields are automatically hidden when they are empty.

(** see my comment in JRA-1678 **)

The best solution is to provide the ability to choose whether or not to hide a field (standard or custom) when it's empty.

So it would be nice to have a flag for each field indicating if this field has to be hidden in issue views.
fields.summary: Provide option to show or hide empty custom fields from issue view screens in Jira server

fields.description:
We have around 500 bugs already created in our database.

1. Create a group called "us-group" and assigned a couple of users (who reported bugs already) to the group.

2. Goto "Find issues", select "Reported By: Specify Group" and enter "us-group".

3. You would expect a listing of all the bugs reported by the users who belong to "us-group" (irrespective of when the group is created i.e. before/after the bug was created). It is not showing the list.
fields.summary: Find Issues shows incorrect results when "Reported By: Specify Group" is selected

fields.description:
System Error

A system error has occurred.

If this problem persists - please notify your JIRA administrator of this problem.

If you are an administrator, please try submitting this problem via the Support Request Page.

If you experience problems getting to this support page, please send an email to jira-support@atlassian.com with the following information:

   1. a description of your problem
   2. cut & paste the error and system information found below
   3. attach the application server log file 

Cause:
Error parsing JSP page /views/forgotusernames-success.jsp

fields.summary: Error retrieving lost username

fields.description:
Failed to import data. Exception:Error in action: com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.DataImport@12a4674, result: error Exception occurred: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:ChangeItem][group,10184][field,description][oldstring,Redo all safeway asset categories and asset category values. OBJECTIVES: 
... 
Step 11a: script: remove_inactive_assets.sql Step 11b: script: add_assets.sql Step 12a: TG exported the data and loaded it into the Survey Tool. ][id,10230] (SQL Exception while setting value: (Data size bigger than max size for this type: 4104)) 

The problem is caused by <oldstring> and <newstring> tags containing text greater than 4000 characters.

I ran the XSLT stylesheet against an XML backup of my xml exported file. The report shows no descriptions or comments exceeding 4000 chars, however the stylesheet fails to recognize the large text fields in tags <oldstring> and <newstring>.

What must been done to clean out the old/new text before for running the import to load the Oracle database.
fields.summary: Oracle import fails because text field greater than 4000 characters
